New Records: The game was completed in 1 hour and 48 minutes, the fastest nine-inning game since 2010.
Jameson Taillon achieved his 200th career start.
The Chicago Cubs clinched a winning season with their victory.
Nick Martinez pitched a five-hitter for his first career complete game.
Key Match Events: The Cubs scored their only run in the fifth inning on a double and a sacrifice fly.
The Reds had multiple baserunners in just one inning.
The game was completed in under two hours.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cubs were aiming for a winning season under new manager Craig Counsell.
The Reds were looking to end their season on a high note.
Post-Match Reflections: Jameson Taillon expressed pride in his performance and the team's quick game.
Nick Martinez was praised for his five-hitter.
Reds interim manager Freddie Benavides noted the challenge of the wind.
Cubs manager Craig Counsell highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The wind blowing in hard affected both teams' performances.
Seiya Suzuki missed his second straight game due to an ankle injury.
Others: The game was compared to a 2001 Cubs win for speed.
The Cubs improved to 4-7 against the Reds this year.
